abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for telecommunications sector
            reform project for Nicaragua were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was low or
            negligible, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            borrower performance was satisfactory. Lessons learned from
            the project: Privatizations are very difficult processes
            that require strong political will to implement. Frequent
            changes in leadership in the implementing agency can delay
            reform processes in the institution. A strong and effective
            project implementation unit kept continuity and maintained
            implementation, despite changes in the leadership of TELCOR.
            While preparing telecommunication rural strategies, it is
            important to count on relevant ad-hoc studies to quantify
            the specific requirements of each individual country.

repnme.cdata!:
Nicaragua - Telecommunications Sector
            Reform Project : Proposed amendment to the credit agreement

abstracts.cdata!:
This amendment to the Development Credit
            Agreement of the Nicaragua Telecommunications Sector Reform
            Project, credit 3291-NI, will restructure one of the
            components of the project, the rural telecommunications
            development component. This component, renamed the Pilot
            Development of Rural Telecommunications, Telecenters and
            Online Government Services, will be divided into three
            separate subcomponents, rural telephony, telecenters in post
            offices, and online government services.  The amendment will
            also extend the Credit's closing date by one year.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Telecommunications Sector Reform
            Project will strengthen the policy, and regulatory
            environment in the telecommunications sector. The design,
            and operations of a rural telecommunications development
            fund will be supported, to provide incentives for private
            investments, thus improving the sector's services in
            those areas. The project components will: 1) strengthen
            institutional capacity, and policy functions of the
            Instituto Nicaraguense de Telecomunicaciones y Correos
            (TELCOR), through: revision, and drafting of legal
            amendments, and regulations; recommendation for
            institutional changes, be it structural, managerial,
            procedural and/or administrative; identification, and
            provision of training needs; and, preparation for an action
            plan; 2) establish new radio spectrum management, and
            monitoring systems, assessing development needs, and,
            procurement related issues; 3) create a rural
            telecommunications development fund, by preparing the
            strategy, and, analysis of legal and economic frameworks,
            for financing the development of pilot community information
            centers to service rural areas; 4) provide legal, and
            financial technical assistance for the on-going
            privatization of the Empresa Nicaraguense de
            Telecomunicaciones (ENITEL); 5) provide management support
            to the implementing agency; and, 6) upgrade software and
            data systems in connection with Y2K problems.
